description: Valuing nature raises significant philosophical and ethical issues. This course considers the nature of animal life, the character and control of pollution, the conflict between preservationism and conservationism, corporate and governmental responsibility for the eco-crisis, the use of economic categories to assess wilderness areas and endangered species, the conflict between eco-holism and individualism, and the philosophy of wilderness management. Offered annually. Also counts toward environmental studies major (all emphases) and environmental studies and management studies concentrations. Prerequisite: BTS-T or permission of instructor.
name: Environmental Ethics
notes: Open only to juniors and seniors.
Prerequisite: completion of BTS-T or permission of instructor.
